title: USGS National Minerals Information Center Web Page
abstract: This data release contains the U.S. salient statistics and world production data extracted from the tables and figures of the USGS Mineral Commodity Summaries 2025 that give an overview of the U.S. mineral industry in 2024.
purpose: Published on an annual basis, the USGS Mineral Commodity Summaries report is the earliest Government publication to furnish estimates covering nonfuel mineral industry data. Data sheets contain information on the domestic industry structure, Government programs, tariffs, and 5-year salient statistics for over 90 individual minerals and materials.
supplinf: Where possible, data are those finalized for publication in the 2023 U.S. Geological Survey Minerals Yearbook Volume I - Metals and Minerals. For 2024, USGS National Minerals Information Center provided estimates based on available data from USGS surveys of the industry, other industry sources, and mineral commodity specialist research.
accconst: None.  Please see 'Distribution Info' for details.
useconst: None.  Users are advised to read the dataset's metadata thoroughly to understand appropriate use and data limitations.
cntorg: U.S. Geological Survey, National Minerals Information Center
othercit: Provides information and links to all available USGS National Minerals Information Center publications by commodity and by geographic area.

title: National Economic Accounts
attraccr: Where possible, data for all years except 2024 have been finalized for publication in the U.S. Geological Survey Minerals Yearbook Volume I - Metals and Minerals; otherwise the data are noted as estimated.
logic: Data were checked to ensure that they match those published in the Mineral Commodity Summaries 2025. Data were peer reviewed by Mineral Commodity Specialists and approved by supervisors in compliance with USGS fundamental science practices.
complete: This data release contains tabular data found in the associated publication Mineral Commodity Summaries 2025 (MCS 2025); additional detailed information is available in the full text version of MCS 2025.
srccontr: U.S. gross domestic product and contributions by mineral-related industries.
procdesc: Salient statistics for each mineral commodity were compiled from published 2023 U.S. Geological Survey Minerals Yearbook Volume I - Metals and Minerals chapters or from finalized tables of those to be published. Data for 2024 were estimated based on available 2023 data and industry trends. Economic data were compiled from various other Federal agencies that are relevant to the U.S. mineral mining and processing industries in relation to the total U.S economy. These data were published in tables and figures accompanying the text of the Mineral Commodity Summaries 2025 overview section. Data from the most current available 2024 economic releases were used as a basis for estimates for the year 2024 made by U.S Geological Survey mineral industry specialists.

enttypd: Comma Separated Value (CSV) file containing data.
attrdef: Percent of scrap exported for recycling
edomvd: year for which data were compiled
udom: Text with notes about the data.
eaover: Each mineral commodity chapter of the 2025 edition of the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) Mineral Commodity Summaries (MCS) includes information on events, trends, and issues for each mineral commodity. Additionally, there is introductory material that provides an overview of events, trends, and issues of the mineral industry as a whole. The data used for the tables and figures of this introductory material have been converted to a csv format as part of the Mineral Commodity Summaries 2025 Data Release. Subjects include industry employment and earnings, total mine production, downstream manufacturing production indexes, capacity utilization. Economic data are also provided for industries that use nonfuel mineral commodities, such as housing, vehicle sales, and highway construction. There is a State table showing value and rank for the mineral industries on a geographic basis.Another table provides net import reliance for those mineral commodities for which the United States is the most dependent on a supply of imports. A special critical minerals table provides additional information on U.S and world production and apparent consumption.
eadetcit: Companion data for graphs and figures of the introductory material in Mineral Commodity Summaries 2025

distliab: Unless otherwise stated, all data, metadata and related materials are considered to satisfy the quality standards relative to the purpose for which the data were collected. Although these data and associated metadata have been reviewed for accuracy and completeness and approved for release by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the display or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty.
